programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Jay's gentle handling of a teenager who has been abused moves Ruth to make a decision about the future of their relationship, and May pleads with Yuki to forgive her deception. However, the real drama of the day is yet to come. Guest starring Patrick Baladi (Mistresses).

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Beech's dodgy past catches up with him when gangster Jimmy Smith calls in a favour. However, Burnside is becoming suspicious of his corrupt colleague. Leslie Grantham and Denise Van Outen guest star.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy goes into hospital for her operation, while Terry suspects Irene of being unfaithful. Martin breaks into Phil's car and steals the stereo.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank is worried about Peggy after her operation. Annie suspects Steve and Matthew, who starts to panic. Barry offers to be Natalie's agency partner.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna is presented with an unenviable dilemma by old flame Martin Henderson, who asks her to leave Cardale and start a new life with him. Meanwhile, an elderly lady reluctant to seek help gives Sam cause for concern. Medical drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Christian Burgess and Joseph Millson.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James, Siegfried and Tristan find different ways of dealing with their domestic problems, and Mrs Hall makes a surprise announcement. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracy and Sharon discover they have been mentioned in an Irish relative's will, but when they arrive on the Emerald Isle they are disappointed to find they have inherited a field. Final episode of the comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: In a festive episode first broadcast in 1995, Hyacinth resorts to alternative methods of recruitment when she gets no response to the adverts for a pageant she is directing. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1995. The Meldrews' wedding anniversary celebrations turn sour as they learn cousin Ursula has died while watching Noel Edmonds - forcing Victor to defy a witch's grim warning and set out to put her affairs in order.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy head for the seaside to spend Christmas in a caravan, leaving Sid and Wally behind. Festive instalment of the long-running rural comedy from 1982, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A teenager sets out to visit her favourite pop star but never returns. Witnesses claim they saw her going into his house, but he pleads his innocence in her disappearance. Offbeat detective drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Alan Davies.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the killing of notorious biker-gang leader Eddie Chapman when his son's girlfriend brings them new information about his death. She reveals her partner must avenge his father's murder as part of a final initiation into the gang, but believes the wrong man is being targeted. Meanwhile, Sandra is forced to reassess her position at Ucos when a former colleague suggests she is wasting her career. Starring Amanda Redman, with her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role.

credits.actor: her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Tina's bungled bank raid brings her back to Larkhall after all, where the inmates of G Wing are enthusiastically rehearsing for a Prison Idol talent contest, though their new music teacher - Lou's drug addict sister Vicky - is more interested in the contents of Rowan Dunlop's medicine cabinet. Janine is desperate for more time alone with Donny Kimber, and Pat looks to dispose of the body she's hidden in a tumble dryer in the laundry.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate a case at Smithfield Market when a frozen body is found on a meat truck. The victim is carrying a page of parchment written in Arabic and a counterfeit British passport. A number of suspects emerge, including a dealer in antiquities, a forger, and a surgeon who may have been selling human organs. With Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Boys School with a Dark Past & More
programme.desc: Ghost hunters contact a dead employee from an abandoned youth centre who is accused of terrible crimes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave risks his money on buying a locker that has not been opened in 20 years, while Barry gets hold of a unique racing car.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod strains his budget by paying too much for a locker full of toys, while Dave shows off his new truck, but finds his rivals are not impressed.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave goes head to head with an old rival, who is famous for making one of the most successful purchases in the history of the storage scene.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell gambles by bidding on a unit full of construction equipment, while Barry brings a secret weapon to the auction.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: The Reels of Fortune crew holds a slight lead over last year's champion, Fishin' Frenzy, but Hard Merchandise and Reel Action are yet to catch a single fish.

programme.title: Salvage Kings
programme.desc: The salvage team team at Priestly Demolition Inc plans to delicately extract fragile stained-glass windows and 200-year-old pine beams from a 19th- century church, but things quickly go sideways.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A local TV news channel wants to turn its SUV into an all-weather mobile news unit to bring to schools to help children learn about weather.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Part one of two. The owners of the Turbinator visit the shop to get a paint job for their land-speed record-holding vehicle.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ryan and Kevin head to the Bonneville Salt Flats to see if the Turbinator will exceed 500 miles per hour.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick needs to find spare parts for an alarm clock that gives the sleeper electric shocks, and also tries to turn a petrol pump into a sports locker.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating claims that China, with its history of technological advancement and isolationism, could have been the home of alien beings.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Apollo 11 mission to the moon and the suggestion that the moon is actually a giant spacecraft allowing extraterrestrials to monitor Earth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi goes to the auction alone, while Darrell buys some vintage bottles.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod prepare to reopen the store as the buyers head for a round of auctions in Hollywood.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Don't Bid So Close to Me
programme.desc: Barry finds an item with a connection to a rock legend at an auction in Rancho Cucamonga, while Brandi and Jarrod examine a vintage mask.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers take a long journey into the desert of Lancaster, California, and Nabila Haniss is richly rewarded for making the trek.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a torch from the 1984 Olympics, the world's smallest pistol and a 1937 car that may once have belonged to gangster Bugsy Siegel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick risks buying a painting supposedly by Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, but then has to ascertain if it is genuine. He also judges the value of a motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered an alternating-current motor invented by 19th-century pioneer Nikola Tesla, and a pair of trainers used in Back to the Future.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys start looking for a new employee to cover the night shift, and examine a collection of antique cast-iron piggy banks and a triple-barrelled gun.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Russia spans over six million square miles of some of the most rugged terrain on Earth, much of which is uninhabited and largely unexplored. It is also the home of cosmism - a belief that human civilization originated in the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The US military has denied that the infamous 1947 Roswell crash was anything other than a weather balloon, but FBI files include a memo to J Edgar Hoover.

programme.title: Salvage Kings
programme.desc: A sweet opportunity pushes Justin to re-evaluate his place on the salvage team. At a century-old theatre that has been empty for over a decade, Ted uncovers a treasure trove of First World War artifacts, including a vintage compass and bayonet.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is joined by a team of antiques dealers in Coventry to offer locals the chance to put their items up for auction or accept a cash sum. Cheryl Hakeney finds herself on the receiving end of a charm offensive by one elderly seller, while everyone is surprised by the high bids one item attracts in the saleroom.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Witney in Oxfordshire, where they haggle over their favourite items, and an autograph book containing Richard Burton and Gracie Fields' signatures causes a stir.

programme.title: UFOs: The White House Files
programme.desc: From Truman to Trump, there has been a legacy of secrecy and controversy surrounding UFOs and the US presidency. This programme ascertains whether these powerful leaders could be hiding the truth from the public.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the world, ancient objects have been found that leave archaeologists at a loss. This programme questions whether these 'impossible artifacts' suggest that advanced - and perhaps even extraterrestrial - civilisations existed on Earth thousands of years before the present one.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A look into lingering rumors that advanced military aircraft, such as the SR-71 Blackbird and B-2 Spirit Bomber, were designed from reverse engineered alien technology.

programme.title: Ken And Barbie Killers: The Lost Murder
programme.desc: The murders of three schoolgirls in the early 1990s shocked Canada. Now, six boxes of unseen evidence shed light on a notorious murder trial..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a variety of unlikely objects, including beer bottles and insects, proved to be sources of vital evidence in murder investigations.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A young professional murdered in her Orlando apartment. Detectives turned to CCTV footage to solve the case and bring a cold-blooded killer to justice.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of how the FBI brought to justice a group of Lebanese terrorists who hijacked a grounded plane in 1985.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: The officers reveal their most stressful, action-packed and heart-wrenching stories from the series.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert follows in his father's steps wrangling Utah, a highly venomous king cobra. A vet from the zoo's hospital, Dr Amber, visits Tandora to care for wild koalas.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride orders a dress from Australia which does not turn up, leaving Jo and Al with just four weeks to come up with an alternative plan before the big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Caressa Cameron who was crowned Miss America 2010 arrives to select bridesmaid dresses for her five-star wedding, but the pressure becomes too much for one of her party.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A would-be bride struggles to convince her exotic-dancer sister to choose a dress suitable for a church wedding, and a pushy mother-of-the-bride ruins her daughter's appointment.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Canada
programme.desc: The team have to fulfil the needs of a bride who has tried on more than 50 dresses but still has not found one that lives up to her ideals.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Canada
programme.desc: A 52-year-old woman wants a dress that makes her look like a princess for her second marriage.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps the owners of Scout, who is so afraid of his tormentor Caramel that he literally lives inside a kitchen cabinet.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A cat is rescued and brought into the shelter after having its paws removed in an act of deliberate cruelty.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: The story of Lalie, who is suffering a mice infestation because her neighbour has acquired one of the biggest hoards seen on the show.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators are called in after a skeleton is found by the side of the road. They suspect the death was unlawful, but struggle to find the evidence needed to prove it.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators assess conflicting accounts of an office party that took a violent turn and left one woman injured.

programme.title: Happily Never After
programme.desc: The murder of New York millionaire Michael Forbes by his wife of two months, who strangled him with an electric wire in November 2007. Despite her claims she was acting in self-defence against her much larger spouse, Kelly Forbes was given a 21-year prison term for her actions.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Danielle Imbo and Richard Petrone, who vanished after leaving a night club on Philadelphia's South Street in February 2005. No evidence of their fate has emerged in the years since, and nor has there been any sight of Petrone's missing vehicle.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into the abduction of a 17-year-old from a shop near his home and the subsequent $30,000 ransom demands.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Chato invites the Atlanta Falcons cheerleaders to help her choose a dress, but the squad is far from united when it comes to knowing what looks best.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country music star Angaleena Presley struggles to make her voice heard as she shops for a wedding dress with her bandmates.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy looks back at some of his favourite appointments, including a Boston Marathon bombing survivor. Plus, a US Air Force veteran receives VIP treatment.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kleinfeld's Bridal unveils its renovation. Plus, celebrity dancer Jenna Johnson needs help finding her reception dress, but her wedding is only two months away.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Gillian Carter from Sheffield became pregnant shortly before her 18th birthday and had hoped to keep the baby with the support of her aunt, but the arrangement fell through due to illness. Now, the 66-year-old is looking forward to a potential reunion with her son. Sandra Macdonald, 53, was given up for adoption in Edinburgh in 1960 and grew up with the feeling something was missing from her life. At the age of 15 she started searching for her birth mother, but she was met by disapproval and misinformation at every turn. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell tell Gillian and Sandra's stories, guiding them through their emotional searches.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part one of two. After successful gastrectomy procedures, Dreier twins Kandi and Brandi lost over 400lbs. This update reveals finds them working toward skin surgeries when a major life event disrupts their world.

programme.title: Deadliest Mums & Dads
programme.desc: When the body of eight-year-old Ayesha Ali was found at her home, investigators eventually uncovered a complex web of lies, manipulation and abuse.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: Ricky Davis was convicted of the 1985 murder of a woman, but always maintained his innocence. It took 18 years before re-examined DNA evidence proved him right.

programme.title: Ken And Barbie Killers: The Lost Murder
programme.desc: The murders of three schoolgirls in the early 1990s shocked Canada. Now, six boxes of unseen evidence shed light on a notorious murder trial..

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A self-taught serial killer crisscrosses the country at random, targeting victims of opportunity and murdering them with pre-stashed weapons and tools he calls 'kill kits'.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance and presumed death of a surgeon's wife sparks a feverish homicide investigation.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: A couple with a liking for menages a trois lead themselves into a fatal catastrophe when they invite a woman with deadly intentions into their home and bed.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The manhunt for a suspected serial killer in Alaska, who left a driver paralysed in a bid to stop his victim from fleeing. Investigators hoped the snow would offer up clues - but found find themselves in a race to act before it melted.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The hunt for Charles Sinclair, a cross-country serial killer who continuously changed his name and hunting grounds. After a five-year chase - and as many kills - authorities traced him to the wilds of Alaska.

programme.title: The Real Prime Suspect
programme.desc: Former DCI Jackie Malton revisits the case of Neil Entwistle, a seemingly shy and unassuming man who murdered his wife and baby daughter in cold blood before fleeing the country.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a friendly woman is murdered inside her home, police suspect her killer is an ex-lover. But after two years and a series of informants, police discover the real perpetrators.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A woman kills a tenant and a landlord after the landlord offered her free rent to take care of his troublesome tenants.
